channel.description: Read the front page stories of csmonitor.com.

item.title: Thabo Mbeki: the fall of Africa's Shakespearean figure
item.description: South Africa's president was ousted by his own party this weekend.

item.title: How $700 billion Paulson-Bernanke plan may help house prices
item.description: Economists hope the proposed bailout will boost confidence and end the cycle of falling real estate values.

item.title: Burma's secret schools of dissent
item.description: Monks teach children critical thinking and human rights, to groom the next generation of activists. Part 3 of three.

item.title: Pakistani militants target foreigners
item.description: Saturday's massive truck bombing, which killed at least 50 people, is seen as a warning to the Pakistani government over its cooperation with the US.

item.title: For young English-speakers gone astray in Israel, a helping hand
item.description: A Texan has set out to assist some of the hundreds of Jews who come to Israel every year and find trouble instead of religious awakening.
